content.text: An algorithm is a method to show the steps in solving a problem. An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure for solving a problem. The need for this is to present a way to solve the problem with a plan.

Three types of control structures are used in an algorithms: i. Sequence, ii. Selection, iii. Repetition

content.title: i. Sequence
content.content: If the steps from the beginning to the end of an algorithm are carried out in order, it is called a sequence.

content.title: iii. Repetition
content.content: If one or several steps of an algorithm are repeated until a condition is met.
examples: Teacher marking attendance till last name
Reading a paragraph and counting words

content.text: When an algorithm is presented in simple English terms it is called a pseudo code. Pseudo codes are independent of a computer language.

content.title: Finding the area of a circle
content.code:
BEGIN
	INPUT Radius
	CALCULATE Area = pi * Radius * Radius
	DISPLAY Area
END.

content.title: Finding whether a number is odd or even
content.code:
BEGIN
	READ number as N
	CALCULATE Remainder after number is divided by 2
	IF Remainder = 0 THEN
		DISPLAY "Even number"
	ELSE
		DISPLAY "Odd number"
	ENDIF
END.

content.title: Finding the total of some numbers
content.code:
BEGIN
	Total = 0
	REPEAT
		READ Number as N
		CALCULATE Total = Total + N
	UNTIL numbers are over
	DISPLAY Total
END.

content.title: Finding the total and the average of 10 numbers
content.code:
BEGIN
	Total = 0
	Average = 0
	n = 1
	WHILE n <= 10
		READ Number
		CALCULATE Total = Total + Number
		n = n + 1
	ENDWHILE
	CALCULATE Average = Total / 10
	DISPLAY (Total, Average)
END.

sections.title: Summary
content: Evaluation of an expression occurs depending on the priority level of functions.
Machine language and Assembly language are considered low-level programming languages.
A program written using Machine language can be directly run in the processor.
A program written in any computer language except in Machine language should be translated to Machine language instructions before it runs.
Interpreter and Compiler are two translation programs.
